snippet.title: Suva coach proud of gutsy effort after top dogs Nadroga are toppled
snippet.content: It's been four years since there was a changing of the guard in Fiji rugby's Farebrother Challenge, so the new holders of the trophy are revelling in the moment. After a run of 25 undefeated matches stretching back to 2013, it was Suva who finally managed to topple Nadroga at the weekend, despite being a man short for most of the game. The defending champions looked to be hanging on for a 26th successful challenge, until Suva summoned the energy to score a late try, and grab the game by single point, 24-23. Coach Saiasi Fuli says he is very proud of his players for finding the will to win against the odds.
